books.title: Silas Marner
books.author: George Eliot
books.summary: A miserly weaver’s isolated life is transformed by the theft of his precious money and the sudden appearance of an abandoned infant, whom he adopts and raises.

books.title: Blue Hand
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A law clerk takes an interest in the disappearance of a well-known woman and her infant daughter, just as their fortune is about to be distributed to a notorious client.

books.title: Personal Memoirs of Ulysses S. Grant
books.author: Ulysses S. Grant
books.summary: One of the greatest generals of the United States tells the story of his life and details his key role in winning the Civil War.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Emily of New Moon
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A budding poetess and orphan goes to live with her estranged aunts.

books.title: The Apple Cart
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: An English king challenges his popular prime minister and cabinet.

books.title: The Doctor’s Dilemma
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A doctor must decide which patient is worthy of his newly discovered cure: a talented but amoral artist, or a good-hearted but undistinguished public servant.

books.title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: An engineer from 19th-century Connecticut is sent back in time to King Arthur’s medieval England.

books.title: The Spy in Black
books.author: J. Storer Clouston
books.summary: A German submarine officer risks his life liaising with British informers during the First World War.

books.title: The Vampire
books.author: John William Polidori
books.summary: A London gentleman goes on an ill-fated trip with a mysterious and sinister newcomer.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.

books.title: Tragedy at Ravensthorpe
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: Chief Constable Sir Clinton Driffield investigates the theft of valuables from a country estate after a masquerade ball.

books.title: The Land of Little Rain
books.author: Mary Austin
books.summary: Short stories and essays detailing the landscape and inhabitants of the American Southwest.

books.title: The Story of Utopias
books.author: Lewis Mumford
books.summary: An American historian reviews the literature surrounding utopias and how they relate to contemporary society.

books.title: The Luzumiyat
books.author: Abu al-ʻAlaʼ al-Maʻarri
books.summary: A collection of quatrains by Abu al-ʻAlaʼ al-Maʻarri.

books.title: Those Barren Leaves
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: An aristocrat summons a group of “intelligentsia” to vacation in her Italian mansion.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Henry Kuttner
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Henry Kuttner, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: John Silence Stories
books.author: Algernon Blackwood
books.summary: A physician turned detective uses his psychic abilities to solve the strange cases presented to him.

books.title: Siddhartha
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A man embarks on a spiritual journey through India.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.
